page.title: 17Flower Festival Wimbish
page.content: In June, a Flower Festival was held in the Parish Church. This was organised by the Churchwardens, Mr.Bob Greene and Mrs.Janet Swan. The Church was decorated with flower arrangements (17 in all) which illustrated the 'Life of Jesus', ranging from 'The Annunciation' to 'The Ascension'. Events in the life of Our Lord were cleverly illustrated by the choice of colours and flowers used. In order to raise money for the Church Fund, the Festival was held over 2 days, and in the grounds of the old rectory (now a private house), were stalls selling plants, cakes and produce, and items made by the local craft group. There was also a barbecue. The Flower Festival raised more than Â£1000.
